t: John 18
Judas Betrays Jesus
When*p Jesus had spoken these words, He went forth with His disciples over the ravine of the Kidron, where there was a garden, in which He entered with His disciples.
Now Judas also, who was betraying Him, knew the place, for Jesus had often met there with His disciples.
Judas then, having received the Roman*i cohort and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns and torches and weapons.
So Jesus, knowing all the things that were coming upon Him, went forth and said to them, “Whom*r do*r you*r seek?”*r
They answered Him, “Jesus the Nazarene.” He said to them, “I*r am*r He.”*ir And Judas also, who was betraying Him, was standing with them.
So when He said to them, “I*r am*r He,”*ir they drew back and fell to the ground.
Therefore He again asked them, “Whom*r do*r you*r seek?”*r And they said, “Jesus the Nazarene.”
Jesus answered, “I*r told*r you*r that*r I*r am*r He;*ir so*r if*r you*r seek*r Me,*r let*r these*r go*r their*r way,”*r
to fulfill the word which He spoke, “Of*r those*r whom*r You*r have*r given*r Me*r I*r lost*r not*r one.”*r
Simon Peter then, having a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s slave, and cut off his right ear; and the slave’s name was Malchus.
So Jesus said to Peter, “Put*r the*r sword*r into*r the*r sheath;*r the*r cup*r which*r the*r Father*r has*r given*r Me,*r shall*r I*r not*r drink*r it?”*r
Jesus before the Priests
So*p the Roman*i cohort and the commander and the officers of the Jews, arrested Jesus and bound Him,
and led Him to Annas first; for he was father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
Now Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jews that it was expedient for one man to die on behalf of the people.
Simon*p Peter was following Jesus, and so*i was*i another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and entered with Jesus into the court of the high priest,
but Peter was standing at the door outside. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the doorkeeper, and brought Peter in.
Then the slave-girl who kept the door said to Peter, “You are not also one*i of this man’s disciples, are you?” He said, “I am not.”
Now the slaves and the officers were standing there,*i having made a charcoal fire, for it was cold and they were warming themselves; and Peter was also with them, standing and warming himself.
The*p high priest then questioned Jesus about His disciples, and about His teaching.

Jesus answered him, “I*r have*r spoken*r openly*r to*r the*r world;*r I*r always*r taught*r in*r synagogues*r and*r in*r the*r temple,*r where*r all*r the*r Jews*r come*r together;*r and*r I*r spoke*r nothing*r in*r secret.*r
Why*r do*r you*r question*r Me?*r Question*r those*r who*r have*r heard*r what*r I*r spoke*r to*r them;*r they*r know*r what*r I*r said.”*r
When He had said this, one of the officers standing nearby struck Jesus, saying, “Is that the way You answer the high priest?”
Jesus answered him, “If*r I*r have*r spoken*r wrongly,*r testify*r of*r the*r wrong;*r but*r if*r rightly,*r why*r do*r you*r strike*r Me?”*r
So Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
Peter’s Denial of Jesus
Now*p Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. So they said to him, “You are not also one*i of His disciples, are you?” He denied it,*i and said, “I am not.”
One of the slaves of the high priest, being a relative of the one whose ear Peter cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”
Peter then denied it*i again, and immediately a rooster crowed.
Jesus before Pilate
Then*p they led Jesus from Caiaphas into the Praetorium, and it was early; and they themselves did not enter into the Praetorium so that they would not be defiled, but might eat the Passover.
Therefore Pilate went out to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this Man?”
They answered and said to him, “If this Man were not an evildoer, we would not have delivered Him to you.”
So Pilate said to them, “Take Him yourselves, and judge Him according to your law.” The Jews said to him, “We are not permitted to put anyone to death,”
to fulfill the word of Jesus which He spoke, signifying by what kind of death He was about to die.
Therefore*p Pilate entered again into the Praetorium, and summoned Jesus and said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
Jesus answered, “Are*r you*r saying*r this*r on*r your*r own*r initiative,*r or*r did*r others*r tell*r you*r about*r Me?”*r
Pilate answered, “I am not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests delivered You to me; what have You done?”

Jesus answered, “My*r kingdom*r is*r not*r of*r this*r world.*r If*r My*r kingdom*r were*r of*r this*r world,*r then*r My*r servants*r would*r be*r fighting*r so*r that*r I*r would*r not*r be*r handed*r over*r to*r the*r Jews;*r but*r as*r it*r is,*r My*r kingdom*r is*r not*r of*r this*r realm.”*r

Therefore Pilate said to Him, “So You are a king?” Jesus answered, “You*r say*r correctly*ir that*r I*r am*r a*r king.*r For*r this*r I*r have*r been*r born,*r and*r for*r this*r I*r have*r come*r into*r the*r world,*r to*r testify*r to*r the*r truth.*r Everyone*r who*r is*r of*r the*r truth*r hears*r My*r voice.”*r
Pilate said to Him, “What is truth?” And*bp when he had said this, he went out again to the Jews and said to them, “I find no guilt in Him.
But you have a custom that I release someone for you at the Passover; do you wish then that I release for you the King of the Jews?”
So they cried out again, saying, “Not this Man, but Barabbas.” Now Barabbas was a robber.
